dt: {bc}a usually rectangular piece of fabric of distinctive design that is used as a symbol (as of a nation), as a signaling device, or as a decoration
{bc}the tail of some dogs (such as a setter or hound)
{bc}the long hair fringing a dog's tail
{bc}something used like a flag to signal or attract attention
{bc}one of the cross strokes of a musical note less than a quarter note in value
{bc}something represented by a flag: such as
{bc}an admiral functioning in his office of command
{bc}the nationality of registration of a ship or aircraft

et: probably akin to {it}fag{/it} end of cloth {ma}{mat|fag end|}{/ma}
shortdef: a usually rectangular piece of fabric of distinctive design that is used as a symbol (as of a nation), as a signaling device, or as a decoration
the tail of some dogs (such as a setter or hound); also : the long hair fringing a dog's tail

dt: {bc}to signal with or as if with a flag
{bc}to mark or identify with or as if with a flag

shortdef: to signal with or as if with a flag; especially : to signal to stop —often used with down
to mark or identify with or as if with a flag
to call a penalty on : penalize

dt: {bc}to decline in interest, attraction, or value

shortdef: to become unsteady, feeble, or spiritless
to decline in interest, attraction, or value

dt: {bc}a hard evenly stratified stone that splits into flat pieces suitable for paving

et: Middle English {it}flagge{/it} turf, perhaps from Old Norse {it}flaga{/it} slab; akin to Old English {it}flōh{/it} chip
shortdef: a hard evenly stratified stone that splits into flat pieces suitable for paving; also : a piece of such stone

shortdef: to lay (something, such as a pavement) with flags

dt: {bc}a pirate's flag usually bearing a skull and crossbones

shortdef: a pirate's flag usually bearing a skull and crossbones

dt: {bc}a common iris ({it}Iris versicolor{/it}) chiefly of the eastern U.S. with a root formerly used medicinally

shortdef: a blue-flowered iris; especially : a common iris (Iris versicolor) chiefly of the eastern U.S. with a root formerly used medicinally

dt: {bc}a flag marked by alternating black and white squares that is waved at the finish line to signal the end of a race

dt.t: Driving with a clear head and a deft right foot rather than an anxious heart, he slid into the lead three laps from the {wi}checkered flag{/wi} …

In one race weekend Andretti had run the gamut—he had been fast qualifier, he had driven at a steady pace in the first 11 hours and he had won a final, desperate sprint to the {wi}checkered flag{/wi}.

He {phrase}took the checkered flag{/phrase} {gloss}=crossed the finish line in first place{/gloss} at California Speedway on Sept. 4 to become the youngest driver in the 56-year history of the Cup series to win a race …

shortdef: a flag marked by alternating black and white squares that is waved at the finish line to signal the end of a race
